15000.name: The King's Road
15000.description:
The area opens at the beginning of the actual King's Road. The road is
wide enough for several horses to ride along side by side with room to
spare. The stones which make up the road have been put into place with
such skill that the road seems to be perfectly smooth and perfectly
straight. You spot a small trail leading to the south through the
undergrowth which surrounds the road at this point. A traveller passes
by and waves cheerfully at you. Buildings crowd together on all sides.
The sounds of city life echo around.

east.description: The King's Road continues in a straight line to the east towards a grand castle.

south.description: A small overgrown trail leads through the undergrowth to the south.

west.description: The King's Road thins out a bit into a lane just to the west.

15001.name: The King's Road
15001.description:
The area opens in the center of the great King's Road. The road is very
well built, and goes in a straight line due east-west. Vendors and
pedestrians bustle past. The smell of smoke and humanity hangs in the
air.

east.description: The King's Road continues in a straight line to the east.

west.description: You see that the King's Road continues westwards towards a large city.

15002.name: The King's Road
15002.description:
The area opens on the King's Road, which leads east and west. The skill
of the builders is apparent, since it is impossible to notice any turn
or irregularity in the road. The sounds of city life echo around. The
smell of smoke and humanity hangs in the air.

east.description: You see a castle in the far east.

west.description: The King's Road continues in a straight line to the west.

15003.name: On The King's Road Outside A Castle
15003.description:
This area is the King's Road. before is a large Castle, evidently built
not so much for strength as for beauty. It is not totally without
defences, though, for it is surrounded by a deep moat, and its windows
are just narrow slits for archers to shoot through. To the north there
is a drawbridge across the moat. Buildings crowd together on all sides.
Vendors and pedestrians bustle past.

north.description: You see the drawbridge.

west.description: The King's Road continues in a straight line to the west.

15004.name: On The Drawbridge
15004.description:
You have arrived at the drawbridge leading into the Castle. before
is a huge, double-doored gate. It seems very strong. You see some whirls
in the moat. The cobblestones are worn smooth by countless feet. The
sounds of city life echo around.

north.description: The gate has huge, but intricately carved hinges.  As the Castle itself, it seems designed not only for strength, but also for beauty.

south.description: You see the King's Road.

west.description: You see an exit west.

15005.name: The Kitchen
15005.description:
This is the Kitchen. Lots of helpers hurry to do the Chief Cook's
bidding, and there is a wonderful smell that makes you feel very hungry.
All around the room, there are shelves with different kinds of cooking
gear stacked on them. There is an exit to the north, and one to the
east; both leading to small passages. The walls are rough-hewn and cold
to the touch. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

north.description: You see a small, dimly lit passage.

east.description: You see a small, dimly lit passage.

15006.name: A Small Passage
15006.description:
This is a small passage, that is clearly intended mostly for the
servants of the Castle. It is only dimly lit and quite narrow. The
passage leads west, and to the east there is a small door. The air is
still and musty. Shadows gather in the corners.

east.description: The door is small and uninteresting.

west.description: You hear clanging of pots, and smell cooking meat.

15007.name: The Entrance Hall
15007.description:
This is the impressive Entrance Hall of the Castle. To the north is an
exit into the Great Hall. There is also an exit east, and a small door
to the west. Shadows gather in the corners. Dust motes drift in the
stale air.

north.description: You see the King's Great Hall.

east.description: There seems to be a small guard room to the east.

south.description: To the south, there is a gate, that leads to the Drawbridge.

west.description: The door is small and uninteresting.

15008.name: The Guard Room
15008.description:
This is a small room, evidently meant for guards currently not on duty.
There is only one exit, back to the entrance hall. Shadows gather in the
corners. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

west.description: You see the Castle Entrance.

15009.name: Under The Tower
15009.description:
The area is below one the three mighty towers of the Castle. There are
no guards here, and you sense that this part of the Castle is largely
unused. There are stairs going up to the tower, and there is also an
exit to the north. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch. The
ceiling hangs low overhead.

north.description: You see a small, dimly lit passage.

up.description: The stairs are old, but in good repair. They lead up into the tower.

15010.name: The Small Passage
15010.description:
This is a small passage, that is clearly intended mainly for the
servants of the Castle. The passage leads north and south. The ceiling
hangs low overhead. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

north.description: You see a small, dimly lit passage.

south.description: You hear the clanging of pots, and smell cooking meat.

15011.name: The Great Hall
15011.description:
This is the south-west end of the Great Hall. It is truly vast; the roof
is so high above your head, that it seems no closer than the clouds
outside. The roof is beautifully painted, by someone who must have been
a true master. The hall is very large, and could easily seat several
hundred people at a banquet. The air is still and musty. The walls are
rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

north.description: You see the King's Great Hall.

east.description: You see the King's Great Hall.

15012.name: The Great Hall
15012.description:
This is the southern end of the Great Hall. It is truly vast; the roof
is so high above your head, that it seems no closer than the clouds
outside. The roof is beautifully painted, by someone who must have been
a true master. The hall is very large, and could easily seat several
hundred people at a banquet. to the north, you see King Welmar's great
throne, and to the south is the Castle Entrance. Dust motes drift in the
stale air. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

north.description: You see the part of the Great Hall where the throne is.

east.description: You see the King's Great Hall.

south.description: You see the Castle Entrance.

west.description: You see the King's Great Hall.

15013.name: The Great Hall
15013.description:
This is the south-east end of the Great Hall. It is truly vast; the roof
is so high above your head, that it seems no closer than the clouds
outside. The roof is beautifully painted, by someone who must have been
a true master. The hall is very large, and could easily seat several
hundred people at a banquet. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the
touch. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

north.description: You see the King's Great Hall.

west.description: You see the King's Great Hall.

15014.name: A Passage
15014.description:
This is a passage, that leads north and south. To the south it leads
towards one of towers. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.
The ceiling hangs low overhead.

north.description: You see the small passage continue.

south.description: A passage leads to Under The Tower

15015.name: The Passage
15015.description:
This is a passage, that leads north and south. To the east there is an
exit to the Great Hall. Dust motes drift in the stale air. The walls are
rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

north.description: You see the passage continue.

east.description: You see the King's Great Hall.

south.description: You see the passage continue.

15016.name: The Great Hall
15016.description:
This is the north-west end of the Great Hall. It is truly vast; the roof
is so high above your head, that it seems no closer than the clouds
outside. The roof is beautifully painted, by someone who must have been
a true master. The hall is very large, and could easily seat several
hundred people at a banquet. to the east, you see King Welmar's great
throne, and to the west there is an exit to a passage. Dust motes drift
in the stale air. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

east.description: You see the part of the Great Hall where the throne is.

south.description: You see the King's Great Hall.

west.description: You see a passage.

15017.name: By The Throne In The Great Hall
15017.description:
The area opens by the King's huge ivory throne. The throne is, to an
even greater degree than the Hall itself, a masterpiece. It is
intricately and beautifully carved, and it seems to be made out of a
single block of ivory, though you shiver at the thought of meeting the
animal that died to yield a piece of that size. The Hall continues to
the east, west and south. The ceiling hangs low overhead. The air is
still and musty.

east.description: You see the King's Great Hall.

south.description: You see the King's Great Hall.

west.description: You see the King's Great Hall.

15018.name: The Great Hall
15018.description:
This is the north-east end of the Great Hall. It is truly vast; the roof
is so high above your head, that it seems no closer than the clouds
outside. The roof is beautifully painted, by someone who must have been
a true master. The hall is very large, and could easily seat several
hundred people at a banquet. to the west, you see King Welmar's great
throne, and to the east there is an exit to a small passage. The air is
still and musty. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

east.description: You see a passage.

south.description: You see the King's Great Hall.

west.description: You see the part of the Great Hall where the throne is.

15019.name: The Small Passage
15019.description:
This is a small passage, that leads north and south. To the west, there
is an exit into the Great Hall. Dust motes drift in the stale air. The
air is still and musty.

north.description: The passage continues to the north.

south.description: The passage continues to the south.

west.description: To the west you see the Great Hall.

15020.name: The Passage
15020.description:
This is a north-south leading passage. There is a door to the east. The
air is still and musty. Dust motes drift in the stale air. The air is
stale and the walls close. Shadows pool in the corners, undisturbed.

north.description: The passage leads to a staircase.

east.description: The door is quite small and unobtrusive.

south.description: The passage continues to the south.

15021.name: The Servants' Corridor
15021.description:
This is a corridor, that stretches further to the east. There are doors
to the north and west. The corridor itself is mainly used by servants,
and lacks some of the beauty of the rest of the castle. Shadows gather
in the corners. The air is still and musty.

north.description: There is a door there!

east.description: The corridor seems to come to its end a bit further east.

west.description: The door to the west is made out of wood.

15022.name: The End Of The Servants' Corridor
15022.description:
The corridor leads only west from here, but there is a door to the
north. The ceiling hangs low overhead. The air is still and musty. The
air is stale and the walls close. Shadows pool in the corners,
undisturbed.

north.description: The door leads to a room intended for the butler.

west.description: You see the corridor continue.

15023.name: The Training Room
15023.description:
This is the Training Room of the men of the Castle guard. It is very
large, with weapons standing in racks by all the walls. Most of the
weapons seem to be intended for training only, with blunt edges and the
like, but there are some that might be useful for real fighting. There
is a door to the north. The ceiling hangs low overhead. The air is still
and musty.

north.description: The door is large and heavy.

east.description: You see a small passage.

15024.name: The Small Passage
15024.description:
This is a small passage leading north and south. There is also an exit
to the west, from which grunts, cheers and heavy blows can be heard.
Shadows gather in the corners. The air is still and musty.

north.description: The passage leads north to some stairs.

south.description: You see the passage continuing.

west.description: You see the Training Room.

15025.name: The Stair Room
15025.description:
The area opens below a great staircase, that leads up to the second
floor of the Castle. The stairs are made of marble, and there are
pillars carved in the likenesses of trees with little animals running up
and down the trunks. The ceiling hangs low overhead. The walls are
rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

south.description: You see the passage.

up.description: The stairs lead up to the second floor.

15026.name: The Servants' Quarters
15026.description:
This is a large room, that seems to house many of the servants. The room
is full of comfortable-looking beds. There is also a large chest,
probably containing some of the servants' belongings. The walls are
rough-hewn and cold to the touch. The air is still and musty.

south.description: The door is made out of wood.

15027.name: The Butler's Quarters
15027.description:
You see at once that this must be the butler's room, for it lies in the
servants' wing, and still it is large and comfortable; almost luxurious,
in fact. There is a large bed and a drawer in the room. The only exit is
via the door to the south. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the
touch. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

south.description: You see the corridor.

15028.name: The Guards' Barracks
15028.description:
This is a very large room with bunks all over. It is obvious, that this
is where the guards off duty spend most of their time, drinking and
gambling or, probably, mostly sleeping. The ceiling hangs low overhead.
The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

south.description: The door is large and heavy.

15029.name: The Stairs
15029.description:
The area opens by a staircase leading down. As you look down, you notice
that for the first time since you entered the castle, things are not
aesthetically made. Instead it looks more functional and prison- like.
The air is still and musty. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

south.description: You see the small passage.

down.description: The stairs down lead into darkness.

15030.name: At A Bend In The Corridor
15030.description:
The area opens at a place where the corridor bends from east to north.
The air is still and musty. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the
touch.

north.description: You see the corridor continue.

east.description: You see the corridor continue.

15031.name: The Corridor
15031.description:
This is a long corridor, decorated with tapestries depicting old times
and old heroes. It leads east and west. The walls are rough- hewn and
cold to the touch. The air is still and musty.

east.description: You see the corridor continue.

west.description: You see the corridor continue.

15032.name: The Corridor
15032.description:
This is a long corridor, decorated with tapestries depicting old times
and old heroes. It leads east and west. Shadows gather in the corners.
The air is still and musty.

east.description: You see the corridor continue.

west.description: You see the corridor continue.

15033.name: The Corridor
15033.description:
This is a long corridor, decorated with tapestries depicting old times
and old heroes. The corridor continues west, and to the north you see
the luxurious guest wing. The ceiling hangs low overhead. Shadows gather
in the corners.

north.description: You see the guest wing.

west.description: You see the corridor continue.

15034.name: In The South-East Tower
15034.description:
This part of the tower is fairly uninteresting, but it leads further
upwards... Shadows gather in the corners. The ceiling hangs low
overhead.

up.description: The room at the top of the tower seems darkish for some reason.

down.description: You see the stairs at the bottom of the tower.

15035.name: The Corridor
15035.description:
This is a long corridor, decorated with tapestries depicting old times
and old heroes. It leads north and south. There is also an exit to the
east here. The ceiling hangs low overhead. Shadows gather in the
corners.

north.description: You see the corridor continue.

east.description: You see a small room.

south.description: You see the corridor continue.

15036.name: By The Treasure Room
15036.description:
The area opens by a great iron door. The door is very large, and seems
very solid indeed. There is a sign posted by it. Shadows gather in the
corners. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

east.description: You see a large steel door.

west.description: You see the corridor.

15037.name: The Great Treasury
15037.description:
As you enter this room, you are astonished by the riches that are stowed
away here; not so much in gold, but paintings, tapestries, skillful
carvings and sculptures all over the vast room. You realise, however,
that most of these things are too well known to be sold anywhere,
without branding yourself as a thief, and condemning yourself to instant
death at the hands of the Royal Guard. Dust motes drift in the stale
air. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

west.description: You see a large steel door.

extra_descs: painting paintings carving carvings sculptures tapestries

15038.name: The Guest Wing
15038.description:
You have arrived at the part of the Castle where prominent guests are
housed. To the east there is a large, ornamented door, and a somewhat
smaller one leads north. The air is still and musty. The ceiling hangs
low overhead.

north.description: The door seems to lead to a guest room.

east.description: You see the guest suite behind the ornamented door.

south.description: You see the corridor.

15039.name: The Guest Suite
15039.description:
This must be where only the most highly regarded guests stay, since it
is luxurious beyond your wildest imagination. This is only the living
room of the suite, but it is huge and tastefully decorated. All the
furniture is not only beautiful, but also made for comfort. To the
north, there is an exit to the bedroom, and there is a door to the west.
Dust motes drift in the stale air. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

north.description: You see the bedroom.

west.description: Behind the door you see the entrance to the Guest Wing.

15040.name: The Corridor
15040.description:
This is a long corridor, decorated with tapestries depicting old times
and old heroes. It leads north and south. Shadows gather in the corners.
The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

north.description: You see the corridor continue.

south.description: You see the corridor continue.

15041.name: The Ball Room
15041.description:
This is the great Ball Room. It is a truly large room, with a stage for
an orchestra in the south-east end. Shadows gather in the corners. The
walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

north.description: You see the Ball Room.

east.description: To the east you see the stage.

15042.name: By The Stage
15042.description:
ahead see the stage. It is large enough for some 40 musicians to play on
at the same time. The Ball Room continues to the west and north. The
ceiling hangs low overhead. Shadows gather in the corners.

north.description: You see the Ball Room.

west.description: You see the Ball Room.

15043.name: A Guest Room
15043.description:
This is a large room. Although it is comfortable enough, you can tell it
is not meant for any of the most illustrious guests, since it lacks that
extreme luxury found elsewhere in the Castle. Dust motes drift in the
stale air. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

south.description: Behind the door, you see the entrance to the Guest Wing.

15044.name: The Bedroom
15044.description:
This room is dominated by the huge four-poster bed, that stands against
the northern wall. The room is large and cosy, and the bed virtually
begs you to lie down in it and sleep. The air is still and musty. Dust
motes drift in the stale air.

south.description: You see the living room of the suite.

15045.name: The Corridor
15045.description:
This is a long corridor, decorated with tapestries depicting old times
and old heroes. It leads north and south. There is an exit to the east,
that leads to a large room. Shadows gather in the corners. The walls are
rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

north.description: You see the corridor continue.

east.description: You see the Ball Room.

south.description: You see the corridor continue.

15046.name: The Ball Room
15046.description:
This is the great Ball Room. It is a truly large room, with a stage for
an orchestra in the south-east end. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to
the touch. The air is still and musty.

east.description: You see the Ball Room.

south.description: You see the Ball Room.

west.description: You see the corridor.

15047.name: The Ball Room
15047.description:
This is the great Ball Room. It is a truly large room, with a stage for
an orchestra in the south-east end. The ceiling hangs low overhead.
Shadows gather in the corners.

east.description: To the east, you can enter a tower.

south.description: To the south you see the stage.

west.description: You see the Ball Room.

15048.name: In The Tower
15048.description:
This is the north-eastern of the three great watch- towers of the
Castle. To the west, you can enter the Ball Room and there are stairs
leading up into the Tower. Shadows gather in the corners. Dust motes
drift in the stale air.

west.description: You see the Ball Room.

up.description: The stairs lead a long way up to the top of the Tower.

15049.name: The Grand Staircase
15049.description:
This area is a great staircase, that leads up and down. To the east,
there is a large oak door, and a corridor leads south. The walls are
rough-hewn and cold to the touch. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

east.description: The door is large and made out of oak.

south.description: You see the corridor.

up.description: The stairs continue up to the top of the tower.

down.description: The stairs lead down to the first floor of the Castle.

15050.name: The Cosy Room
15050.description:
The entrance opens to a large, cosy living room. There is a fireplace
with a fire burning, and a few comfortable chairs around a little table.
There is a door to the west, and also an exit to the east. The air is
still and musty. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

east.description: You see a large bedroom.

west.description: The door is large, and made out of oak.

15051.name: King Welmar's Bedroom
15051.description:
This is a large room, with a wonderful view. To one side of the room,
stands a large four-poster bed. All around the room there are massive
bookshelves, filled with all kinds of books. The titles include works
such as: 'A Treatise on the History of Midgaard and surrounding areas',
'Magic - A Beginner's Introduction' and many others. There is an exit to
the west. The ceiling hangs low overhead. Dust motes drift in the stale
air.

west.description: There is a large and cosy room to the west.

15052.name: Up In The Tower
15052.description:
After a long climb, you finally reach the top of the tower. This room is
small, and the only light source is a flickering candle, on a cluttered
table, in the middle of the room. The only obvious exit is back down the
stairs. The ceiling hangs low overhead. The walls are rough-hewn and
cold to the touch.

down.description: The stairs go down the tower.

15053.name: The Top Of The Tower
15053.description:
You have arrived at the top of the tower. This tower is pretty
uninteresting, and seems made purely for reasons of defence and
guarding. The windows are slits for bowmen, very narrow on the outward
side and broad inwards to allow a wide shooting angle. The only evident
exit is down the stairs again. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the
touch. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

down.description: The stairs go down to the second floor.

15054.name: The Top Of The Tower
15054.description:
This is the highest of all the towers, and is obviously used for lookout
purposes. The view is splendid in all four directions. All around, the
rich countryside spreads out to the horizon. To the north and east you
see a vast mountain range, and far to the west a beautiful lake. A bit
closer, the town of Midgaard lies at the end of the King's Road. The
only exit Visible is is down again. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to
the touch. Shadows gather in the corners.

down.description: You see the stairs going back down to the second floor.

15055.name: The Bottom Of The Stairs
15055.description:
The stairs lead down to a damp part of the castle, you can hear water
dripping somewhere around. The area is lit by a single torch
flickering in the room which this staircase is built off of. The stairs
lead upwards and they open up onto a fairly small room to the east. The
walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch. Shadows gather in the
corners.

east.description: A small room opens up to the east.

up.description: The stairs lead upwards out of this dank, dark place.

15056.name: The Guard Room
15056.description:
This is a loss to explain why someone would want to spend all day down
here. The only explanation that seems even remotely logical to you is
that there must be an important prisoner kept in one of the cells
through the south door. The decorations of the room are sparse, merely a
table, a chair, and a deck of cards. A stairwell has been built into the
western wall and it leads upwards. Dust motes drift in the stale air.
The air is still and musty.

south.description: Through the peep hole at the top of the small wooden door you can see that there is a small corridor leading past several cells.

west.description: A small stairwell built into the western wall of the room leads upwards.

15057.name: The Prison
15057.description:
This small passage is about thirty feet long and is well lit by the
torches on each wall. The torches have been locked inside small metal
cages to ensure that they are not removed. The strangest thing about the
torches however, is the manner in which they burn, they have what
appears to be a constant flame in that it does not flicker whatsoever,
and does not give off any smoke. Perhaps they have been magicked to burn
forever... There are three cells along this passage way, one on each
side of the corridor right near the north end and one isolated at the
south end of the corridor with a small metal plaque located over the
door in the keystone of the archway. Dust motes drift in the stale air.
Shadows gather in the corners.

north.description: A small wooden door blocks the way out of the prison.

east.description: A cell door is set into the eastern wall.

south.description: The cell door to the south has been double padlocked and there is a plaque placed in the keystone above the door.

west.description: A cell door is set into the western wall.

15058.name: A Cell
15058.description:
This cell is in a shambles. There is a small hole in the western wall
where something has broken through the stones into the cell. There is a
cell door in the eastern wall. The air is still and musty. The walls are
rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

east.description: The cell door to the east leads back to the prison hallway.

15059.name: Ergan's Cell
15059.description:
This large cell is almost like a living quarters with a cot in one
corner serving as a bed, a small table built out of the wall in another
corner. There is even a rug in the center of the floor to keep some
warmth. It seems that the prisoner kept here is treated quite well,
almost too well for a murderer of an entire town... Shadows gather in
the corners. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

north.description: The cell door to the north leads back to the prison hallway.

15060.name: A Cell
15060.description:
This small cell is damp and dark and looks like noone and nothing has
lived in it for quite some time. A small cell door is located in the
west wall. Shadows gather in the corners. Dust motes drift in the stale
air.

west.description: The cell door to the west leads back to the prison hallway.

15061.name: An Overgrown Trail
15061.description:
Moving off of the King's Road, you find yourself on a small fading trail
which appears to have been so little used that it has almost completely
grown over with vegitation from the woods here. Sounds of the forest can
be heard all round and you feel a peaceful feeling come over you as you
realize that mankind has not passed this way for some time. The faded
trail appears to lead north and south. Rocks jut from the grassy slopes.
The view stretches for miles in every direction.

north.description: The travel upon the King's Road can be heard off to the north.

south.description: The trail continues southwards.

15062.name: An Overgrown Trail
15062.description:
Continuing through the heavy undergrowth, you find yourself in the
middle of the forest. The sounds of the forest can be heard all round
and you feel a peaceful feeling come over you as you realize that
mankind has not passed this way for some time. The fading trail you are
on appears to have been so little used that it has almost completely
grown over with vegitation from the woods here. The faded trail appears
to lead north and east. Rocks jut from the grassy slopes. The view
stretches for miles in every direction.

north.description: The trail continues northwards.

east.description: The trail appears to continue to the east.

15063.name: An Overgrown Trail
15063.description:
Continuing through the heavy undergrowth, you find yourself in the
middle of the forest. The sounds of the forest can be heard all round
and you feel a peaceful feeling come over you as you realize that
mankind has not passed this way for some time. The fading trail you are
on appears to have been so little used that it has almost completely
grown over with vegitation from the woods here. The faded trail appears
to lead west and south. To the south a strange eerie silence seems to
hang in the air, almost blocking out all the sounds that you can hear
from the north and east. Rocks jut from the grassy slopes. Sheep trails
wind between the hillocks.

south.description: The undergrowth begins to open up to the south and you can see what appears to be a small village to the south.  It is very quiet, almost too quiet.

west.description: The overgrown trail continues to the northwest.

15064.name: A Dirt Road
15064.description:
As you leave the forest to the north, you find yourself at what appears
to be the beginning of a dirt road and a small village. Upon first
laying eyes on this place you realize that there is something funny
about this settlement... there is no sound other that the whistling wind
here. You would have expected to hear people going about their regular
business, but the village is silent. You cannot see any movement around
the village either. It is almost as still and silent as the woods to the
north. There is a small sign lying by the side of the road here. Tall
grass sways in a gentle breeze. The air is fresh and clean.

north.description: An trail leads into the heavy undergrowth to the north.

south.description: The dirt road continues through the village to the south.

west.description: A house stands a short distance off the west side of the road, its door hanging ajar.

15065.name: A Small Intersection
15065.description:
Continuing along the dirt road, you find yourself at a place where a
small path splits away from the main road and leads off to the west. The
woods around the village seem to be pressing inwards towards you as if
the village hides a secret which they do not want to be spread about.
There is another house standing on the east side of the road. Tall grass
sways in a gentle breeze. The ground is soft underfoot.

north.description: The dirt road continues to the north.

east.description: You can hear a wailing sound coming from the house to the east.

south.description: The dirt road continues towards the south where a horrible smell permeates the air.

west.description: A small, dark trail leads off into the woods to the west.

15066.name: A Dirt Road
15066.description:
This section of the dirt road is quiet, but there is an awful stench in
the air. It brings to mind rotting corpses and raw sewage. The woods
contiue to press closely about you, and almost totally surround the
small building to the west with a thatched roof. There is a blackened
shell of a building to the east with a small sign hanging out front from
a black and charred chain. The dirt road continues north and south. The
air is fresh and clean. The ground is soft underfoot.

north.description: The small dirt road continues towards the north.

east.description: The building to the east is merely a shell of what it once probably was.  The walls are blackened as if they had been exposed to fire at some point in the past...

south.description: The stench from the south is almost overpowering now... it seems that the source wouldn't be too far from here.

west.description: A small quiet cottage stands on the west side of the road, apparently untouched by the desecration and destruction that appears to have hit this small village.

15067.name: A Large Pit
15067.description:
The dirt road ends at the edge of a large pit here and you now realize
where the awful smell was coming from. This pit appears to be a mass
grave for the citizens of the village. There are bones and corpses lying
all over the place. A lot of the corpses look too recent to be from the
Townsbridge murders of almost a decade ago, but the village seems to
have been empty for almost that long. The dirt road leads away from the
carnage to the north. The air is fresh and clean. Tall grass sways in a
gentle breeze.

north.description: Just near the north edge of the pit a small and narrow trail leads away.

15068.name: A House
15068.description:
This house is a wreck, furniture has been strewn all about the room, and
it looks like a tornado landed right in the middle of the room. The
destruction that has taken place in this room is almost beyond belief.
The oddest part of it all though, is how it all seems so recent, since
there are no cobwebs, and there is no dust on anything. The dirt road
can be seen to the east through the doorway. The air is still and musty.
The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

east.description: You can see the dirt road through the doorway to the east.

15069.name: A House
15069.description:
This darkened room is barely lit by the outdoor light, but what you can
see of it gives you the creeps. There are cobwebs dangling from
everything, a thick layer of dust begins to rise up at your passage, and
a strange howl comes from somewhere around. The furniture in this
house is old and of a type that hasn't been seen around these lands for
some time. If it was in better shape, you might be able to sell it as
antique. The meager light of the road shines through the doorway to the
west. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch. The ceiling hangs
low overhead.

west.description: You can see the dirt road through the doorway to the west.

15070.name: A Small Cottage
15070.description:
This cottage looks to have been left in exactly the same shape as it was
in quite some time ago. It looks as if the residents left one day and
haven't returned home yet. Oddly enough, the furniture is dust free and
the food on the table still looks fresh. This house is really strange,
perhaps it wuld be in your best interests to leave as soon as humanly
possible. The road is back through the open doorway to the east. Shadows
gather in the corners. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

east.description: You can see the dirt road through the doorway to the east.

15071.name: The Burned Shop
15071.description:
As you enter this small building, you notice that that blackened walls
are due to a fire that seemed to burn here unattended for quite some
time. There is almost nothing left of the roof that would have once
covered this building, and the north and east walls have been burnt to
almost half the height of the other two walls. There are some burnt
goods around on the ground and the remains of a counter near what is
left of the north wall seems to indicate that this was once a shop. The
road lies to the west through the blackened wall. Wildflowers dot the
landscape. Tall grass sways in a gentle breeze.

west.description: You can see the dirt road to the west.

15072.name: A Dark Path
15072.description:
As you move away form the open air into the darkness of the path and the
sinister looking woods around, you get a feeling of awe and something
almost akin to horror. The wood around is completely silent, not even
the rustling of leaves or the cracking of branches breaks the silence.
The final thing you notice is that the darkness all around seems to be
almost contrived, and doesn't seem natural for this kind of vegitation.
The path continues west and Visible is light to the east. Vendors and
pedestrians bustle past. The sounds of city life echo around you.

east.description: The path continues towards a small intersection with a dirt road.

west.description: The path continues through the darkness.

15073.name: A Dark Path
15073.description:
This narrow path leads through the overhanging trees in the unnatural
darkness. It seems almost as if the trees are crowding in on you here,
as if they didn't want to feel your presence. The wood is almost totally
silent and you wonder silently to yourself why this could be. The path
appears to continue east and west. Buildings crowd together on all
sides. The cobblestones are worn smooth by countless feet.

east.description: The path continues through the darkness.

west.description: The glow from the west appears to be quite strong, but it does not give enough light to see by here, nor can you see the source of the glow.

15074.name: The Circle Of Stones
15074.description:
This is the edge of a circle of seven large monolith-like stones. Each
stone towers over your head and appears to be at least double your
height. The stones are made of a dark black material, almost black in
colour. In the center of the ring of stones, Visible is a black circular
mirror-like disk on the ground. The surface is highly reflective and
almost appears to be rippling. The trees surrounding the circle tower
far above your heads blocking out the sky. A strange glow seems to be
emanating from each stone, almost green in colour. This glow provides
enough light for you to see with even though the sky above has been
blotted out. The smell of smoke and humanity hangs in the air. Buildings
crowd together on all sides.

east.description: A narrow path leads away into the darkness.

extra_descs.ach stone is at least fifteen feet tall,: material glows with a greenish aura providing more than enough light for you to see by.

15000.name: gwydion
15000.long_desc: Gwydion the Royal Guard is here on duty.
15000.description:
As all members of the Guard, Gwydion wears the chain mail required
of them as uniform.  He seems very well trained, and moves like an
experienced fighter.

15001.name: king
15001.long_desc: The wise King Welmar sits here in his throne.
15001.description:
In his later middle-age, with his beard starting to grey, King Welmar
is still very powerfully built, and wouldn't take kindly to an attack.
Despite that, you know he is well-loved throughout the land, and has
a reputation as a wise and just ruler.

15002.name: ghost
15002.long_desc: You hear a frightening wail, and see a horrible ghost approaching.
15002.description: The ghost is almost translucent, and looks really SCARY!

15003.name: jim
15003.long_desc: Jim the Royal Guard is here on duty.
15003.description:
As all members of the Guard, Jim wears the chain mail required of
them as uniform.  He seems very well trained, and moves like an
experienced fighter.

15004.name: brian
15004.long_desc: Brian the Royal Guard is here, training with the Master.
15004.description:
As all members of the Guard, Brian wears the chain mail required of
them as uniform.  He seems very well trained, and moves like an
experienced fighter.

15005.name: mick
15005.long_desc: Mick the Royal Guard is here, training with the Master.
15005.description:
As all members of the Guard, Mick wears the chain mail required of
them as uniform.  He seems very well trained, and moves like an
experienced fighter.

15006.name: matt
15006.long_desc: Matt the Royal Guard is here on duty.
15006.description:
As all members of the Guard, Matt wears the chain mail required of
them as uniform.  He seems very well trained, and moves like an
experienced fighter.

15007.name: jochem
15007.long_desc: Jochem the Royal Guard sits here, off duty.
15007.description:
As all members of the Guard, Jochem wears the chain mail required of
them as uniform.  He seems very well trained, and moves like a fighter
who has seen more than one battle, and longs to see the next!

15008.name: anne
15008.long_desc: Anne the Royal Guard is here on duty.
15008.description:
As all members of the Guard, Anne wears the chain mail required of
them as uniform.  She seems very well trained, and moves like a fighter
who has seen more than one battle, and longs to see the next!

15009.name: andrew
15009.long_desc: Andrew the Royal Guard is here on duty.
15009.description:
As all members of the Guard, Andrew wears the chain mail required of
them as uniform.  He seems very well trained, and moves like a fighter
who has seen more than one battle, and longs to see the next!

15010.name: bertram
15010.long_desc: Bertram the Royal Guard is here on duty.
15010.description:
As all members of the Guard, Bertram wears the chain mail required of
them as uniform.  He seems very well trained, and carries his scars
with pride.  This guy seems tough...

15011.name: jeanette
15011.long_desc: Jeanette the Royal Guard is here on duty.
15011.description:
As all members of the Guard, Jeanette wears the chain mail required of
them as uniform.  She seems very well trained, and carries her scars
with pride.  This girl could be nasty if she wanted to...

15012.name: peter
15012.short_desc: Peter, the Captain of the Royal Guard
15012.long_desc: Peter, the Captain of the Royal Guard, walks around inspecting.
15012.description:
As all members of the Guard, Peter wears the chain mail required of
them as uniform.  Even though all the other guards seem well trained,
you realise none of them would stand a chance against this man in a
fight.  He stands at least two metres tall, but still moves with an
almost feline grace.  He actually radiates strength and confidence,
and you have to fight a sudden urge to come to attention as you see
him.

15013.name: master
15013.long_desc: The Training Master is here, supervising.
15013.description:
Aged, but experienced, the Training Master is skilled in the use
of virtually every weapon type invented by Man.

15014.name: herald
15014.long_desc: The Royal Herald is standing here.
15014.description:
This is a young, powerfully built man, whose primary function
is to make Royal Announcements.

15015.name: ergan
15015.long_desc: Slumped in a corner you see Ergan, aka the Murderer of Townsbridge.
15015.description:
You remember a time almost a decade ago, when the news of the day
was how this man had slaughtered the entire population of the little
village of Townsbridge.  He was imprisoned, and here he is - a shadow
of the undoubtedly great warrior he once was, but still to be reckoned
with.

15016.name: butler
15016.long_desc: James the Butler is standing here, looking pompous.
15016.description:
The typical perfect butler: upper middle age, a bit bald and with 
an impressive belly.

15017.name: woman
15017.long_desc: There is a Cleaning Woman here, trying not be noticed.
15017.description: Although she has a menial job, she seems to like it.

15018.name: cockroach
15018.long_desc: A large cockroach is crawling by the wall.
15018.description: Very large indeed, and they say cockroaches are hard to kill...

15019.name: astrologer
15019.long_desc: The Astrologer is sitting here, studying a book.
15019.description:
He is old and white-haired, with a long beard.  As you see him,
you can almost believe the rumours about stars deciding Fate,
and that astrology is capable of seeing the future.

15020.name: tim
15020.long_desc: Tim, the King's Lifeguard, is standing here.
15020.description:
This guy looks just like his twin, Tom.  There seems to be no
doubt that he is completely prepared to give his life for the
King, if necessary.

15021.name: tom
15021.long_desc: Tom, the King's Lifeguard, is standing here.
15021.description:
This guy looks just like his twin, Tim.  There seems to be no
doubt that he is completely prepared to give his life for the
King, if necessary.

15022.name: chef
15022.long_desc: The Chef is here, shouting orders to the other cooks.
15022.description:
It seems he has been tasting his own food a bit too enthusiastically.
He is, in other words, a bit fat.

15023.name: cook
15023.long_desc: There is a cook here, making himself busy with a pot.
15023.description: A junior cook, eager to do the Chef's bidding.

15024.name: david
15024.long_desc: David, a big, mean-looking man, stands here, guarding the door.
15024.description:
He really is big, and you get the feeling he wouldn't take kindly
to an attempt to get past him.

15025.name: dick
15025.long_desc: Dick, a big, mean-looking man, stands here, guarding the door.
15025.description:
He really is big, and you get the feeling he wouldn't take kindly
to an attempt to get past him.

15026.name: jerry
15026.long_desc: Jerry the Royal Guard is here off duty, playing dice.
15026.description:
As all members of the Guard, Jerry wears the chain mail required
of them as uniform.  He seems very well trained, and moves like
an experienced fighter.

15027.name: michael
15027.long_desc: Michael the Royal Guard is here off duty, playing dice.
15027.description:
As all members of the Guard, Michael wears the chain mail required
of them as uniform.  He seems very well trained, and moves like an
experienced fighter.

15028.name: hans
15028.long_desc: Hans the Royal Guard is here on duty.
15028.description:
As all members of the Guard, Hans wears the chain mail required
of them as uniform.  He seems very well trained, and moves like
a fighter who has seen more than one battle, and longs to see
the next!

15029.name: boris
15029.long_desc: Boris the Royal Guard is here on duty.
15029.description:
As all members of the Guard, Boris wears the chain mail required of
them as uniform.  He seems very well trained, and carries his scars
with pride.  This guy seems tough...

15030.name: zombie
15030.long_desc: A zombie is shambling over some corpses here, moving quite silently.
15030.description:
It is entirely possible that this zombie was once one of the villagers
of Townsbridge who has been brought to an undead life by a fuelling
desire for revenge.

15031.name: skeleton
15031.long_desc: A skeleton is moving about with a loud clatter here, climbing over corpses.
15031.description:
It is entirely possible that this skeleton was once one of the villagers
of Townsbridge who has been brought to an undead life by a fuelling desire
for revenge.

15032.name: pit
15032.long_desc: A large demon surrounded by flames rises out of the dark pool.
15032.description:
It is a horrifying thing, this demonic creature from the depths of the
Abyss.  It glares down at you through blood-red eyes, and bares its huge
white fangs and its razor-sharp talons.

15000.name: nothingness
15000.room_desc: You are quite unable to perceive Sapowox's Universal Nothingness here.

15001.name: gold
15001.room_desc: A lot of gold is here.

15002.name: sceptre
15002.room_desc: A golden Royal sceptre lies on the ground.

15003.name: crown
15003.room_desc: A magnificently jewelled golden crown has been left here.

15004.name: apple
15004.room_desc: There is a golden apple here.

15005.name: telescope
15005.room_desc: There is a large telescope here, pointing at the sky.

15006.name: sword
15006.room_desc: A training sword with blunt edges is leaned against a wall.

15007.name: key
15007.room_desc: There is a huge, heavy-looking key on the floor here.

15008.name: Verminator
15008.room_desc: A strange looking sword is lying upon the ground here.

15011.name: chest
15011.room_desc: A large wooden chest stands here in a corner.

15012.name: vial
15012.room_desc: A large vial has been left here.

15013.name: banner
15013.room_desc: The royal banner has been firmly planted in the ground here.

15014.name: key
15014.room_desc: A key lies on the floor.

15015.name: hauberk
15015.room_desc: A chain mail hauberk lies on the floor

15016.name: broadsword
15016.room_desc: There is a large broadsword lying here.

15017.name: key
15017.room_desc: A key lies on the floor.

15018.name: corpse
15018.room_desc: There is a corpse lying in the middle of the floor of the building here.

15019.name: lobster
15019.room_desc: A delicious-looking lobster is lying here, tempting your appetite.

15020.name: caviar
15020.room_desc: There is some delicious-looking Russian caviar here, making your mouth water.

15021.name: glow
15021.room_desc: There is a strange glow coming from the west.

15022.name: wail
15022.short_desc: the wailing sound from the east
15022.room_desc: There is an eerie wailing sound coming from the house to the east.
